Legal_Issue: Credibility assessment, delay in claiming status, adequacy of state protection
Evidence_Type: Testimony, psychological evidence, contradictory evidence on state protection
Legal_Provision: Section 96 and Section 97 of IRPA, Gender Guidelines
Basis_of_Claim: Gender-based persecution due to domestic abuse
Application_Error: Failure to consider psychological impacts, lack of reasons for rejecting explanations
Evidence_Ignored: Psychological impacts of abuse, evidence contradicting state protection adequacy
Legal_Standard: Reasons must align with legal requirements and evidence
Application_Factor: Impact of trauma on memory and behavior
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Decision_Review_Issue: Procedural fairness, credibility reasoning, state protection analysis
Cause_of_Refusal: Perceived lack of credibility, unexplained delay, belief in state protection
Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistencies in testimony, lack of documentation
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge based on procedural unfairness and misapplication of Gender Guidelines
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Charter of Rights and Freedoms (implied)
Omission_Type: Failure to consider Gender Guidelines and psychological evidence
